trans-unit.source: Tagging a Virtual Machine through Templates
trans-unit.target: Tagging a Virtual Machine through Templates

trans-unit.source: First, let’s look at tagging through templates.
trans-unit.target: First, let’s look at tagging through templates.

trans-unit.source: [This template](https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/tree/master/101-tags-vm) places tags on the following resources: Compute (Virtual Machine), Storage (Storage Account), and Network (Public IP Address, Virtual Network, and Network Interface).
trans-unit.target: [This template](https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/tree/master/101-tags-vm) places tags on the following resources: Compute (Virtual Machine), Storage (Storage Account), and Network (Public IP Address, Virtual Network, and Network Interface).

trans-unit.source: (This template example is for a Windows VM but can be adapted for Linux VMs.)
trans-unit.target: (This template example is for a Windows VM but can be adapted for Linux VMs.)

trans-unit.source: Click the **Deploy to Azure** button from the [template link](https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/tree/master/101-tags-vm).
trans-unit.target: Click the **Deploy to Azure** button from the [template link](https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/tree/master/101-tags-vm).

trans-unit.source: This will navigate to the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com/) where you can deploy this template.
trans-unit.target: This will navigate to the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com/) where you can deploy this template.

trans-unit.source: Simple deployment with Tags
trans-unit.target: Simple deployment with Tags

trans-unit.source: This template includes the following tags: *Department*, *Application*, and *Created By*.
trans-unit.target: This template includes the following tags: *Department*, *Application*, and *Created By*.

trans-unit.source: You can add/edit these tags directly in the template if you would like different tag names.
trans-unit.target: You can add/edit these tags directly in the template if you would like different tag names.

trans-unit.source: Azure tags in a template
trans-unit.target: Azure tags in a template

trans-unit.source: As you can see, the tags are defined as key/value pairs, separated by a colon (:).
trans-unit.target: As you can see, the tags are defined as key/value pairs, separated by a colon (:).

trans-unit.source: The tags must be defined in this format:
trans-unit.target: The tags must be defined in this format:

trans-unit.source: Save the template file after you finish editing it with the tags of your choice.
trans-unit.target: Save the template file after you finish editing it with the tags of your choice.

trans-unit.source: Next, in the **Edit Parameters** section, you can fill out the values for your tags.
trans-unit.target: Next, in the **Edit Parameters** section, you can fill out the values for your tags.

trans-unit.source: Edit Tags in Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Edit Tags in Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Click **Create** to deploy this template with your tag values.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create** to deploy this template with your tag values.

trans-unit.source: Tagging through the Portal
trans-unit.target: Tagging through the Portal

trans-unit.source: After creating your resources with tags, you can view, add, and delete tags in the portal.
trans-unit.target: After creating your resources with tags, you can view, add, and delete tags in the portal.

trans-unit.source: Select the tags icon to view your tags:
trans-unit.target: Select the tags icon to view your tags:

trans-unit.source: Tags icon in Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Tags icon in Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Add a new tag through the portal by defining your own Key/Value pair, and save it.
trans-unit.target: Add a new tag through the portal by defining your own Key/Value pair, and save it.

trans-unit.source: Add new Tag in Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Add new Tag in Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Your new tag should now appear in the list of tags for your resource.
trans-unit.target: Your new tag should now appear in the list of tags for your resource.

trans-unit.source: New Tag saved in Azure portal
trans-unit.target: New Tag saved in Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Viewing your tags in the usage details
trans-unit.target: Viewing your tags in the usage details

trans-unit.source: Tags placed on Compute, Network, and Storage resources through the Azure Resource Manager will be populated in your usage details in the [billing portal](https://account.windowsazure.com/).
trans-unit.target: Tags placed on Compute, Network, and Storage resources through the Azure Resource Manager will be populated in your usage details in the [billing portal](https://account.windowsazure.com/).

trans-unit.source: Click on **Download usage details** to view the usage details in your subscription.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Download usage details** to view the usage details in your subscription.

trans-unit.source: Usage details in Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Usage details in Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Select your billing statement and the **Version 2** usage details:
trans-unit.target: Select your billing statement and the **Version 2** usage details:

trans-unit.source: Version 2 Preview Usage Details in Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Version 2 Preview Usage Details in Azure portal

trans-unit.source: From the usage details, you can see all of the tags in the **Tags** column:
trans-unit.target: From the usage details, you can see all of the tags in the **Tags** column:

trans-unit.source: Tags column in Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Tags column in Azure portal

trans-unit.source: By analyzing these tags along with usage, organizations will be able to gain new insights into their consumption data.
trans-unit.target: By analyzing these tags along with usage, organizations will be able to gain new insights into their consumption data.
